test-set.name: key
test-set.description: Test xsl:key and the key() function

source.content: <t04> <a id="a" code="1" value="10"/> <a id="b" code="2" value="20"/> <a id="c" code="2" value="30"/> <a id="d" code="1" value="50"/> </t04>

test-case.name: key-001
test-case.description: Test generate-id() as used in grouping.

test-case.name: key-002
test-case.description: test use of third parameter of key() to select a subtree

result.assert-xml: <out><ct-only><town name="Enfield" state="CT"/></ct-only><all-states><town name="Enfield" state="NH"/><town name="Enfield" state="ME"/><town name="Enfield" state="CT"/></all-states></out>

test-case.name: key-003
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key, where value of use is a string constant.

result.assert-xml: <out>Intro Section SS Section Exp Section Num Section,Intro Section,</out>

test-case.name: key-004
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key, where value of use is an integer.

test-case.name: key-005
test-case.description: Test of 'generate-id()' - ensure same node generates same ID.

test-case.name: key-006
test-case.description: Test of generate-id() uniqueness. All IDs should be different.

test-case.name: key-007
test-case.description: Test for match attribute being first in xsl:key.

test-case.name: key-008
test-case.description: Test for use attribute being first in xsl:key.

test-case.name: key-009
test-case.description: Test key() with a node-set as second argument. "When the second argument to key is of type node-set, then the result is the union of the result of applying the key function to the string value of each of the nodes in the argument node-set."

test-case.name: key-010
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key and key() with a qualified name.

test-case.name: key-011
test-case.description: Author: David Marston Purpose: Test for xsl:key being imported

test-case.name: key-012
test-case.description: Test for nested calls to key() function

result.assert-xml: <root> The next key finds three divisions: </root>

test-case.name: key-013
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key and key() with a qualified name, different prefix.

test-case.name: key-014
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key and key() with a leading underscore in the name.

test-case.name: key-015
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key matching multiple keys on same node. "There can be multiple keys in a document with the same node, same key name, but different key values."

test-case.name: key-016
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key matching multiple nodes on same looked-up value. "There can be multiple keys in a document with the same key name, same key value, but different nodes."

result.assert-xml: <root>4 divisions: Intro Section.SS Section. The next key finds two divisions: Exp Section.Second Exp Section.</root>

test-case.name: key-017
test-case.description: Test xsl:key where match nodes occur at different levels in the document.

test-case.name: key-018
test-case.description: Test for three keyspaces using the same nodes as keys.

result.assert-xml: <root>Intro Section.SS Section.Exp Section. Intro Section.SS Section.Exp Section. SS Section.Exp Section.</root>

test-case.name: key-019
test-case.description: David Marston --> Purpose: Test for variable as first argument to key().

result.assert-xml: <root> Using keyspace bigspace... Intro Section.SS Section.Exp Section.</root>

test-case.name: key-020
test-case.description: Test for three keyspaces, some being imported.

result.assert-xml: <root> bigspace...Intro Section.SS Section.Exp Section. smallspace...Intro Section.SS Section.Exp Section. filterspace...SS Section.Exp Section.</root>

test-case.name: key-021
test-case.description: Test combination of key() and document() as suggested in spec.

test-case.name: key-022
test-case.description: Test whether blank keying (use) value works or is ignored.

test-case.name: key-023
test-case.description: Test whether blank keying (use) value works when it's an attribute.

test-case.name: key-024
test-case.description: Use content of an element as the "use" value.

test-case.name: key-025
test-case.description: Test that 'generate-id()' on various kinds of nodes yields unique values for each Get in position so we have nodes on the following axis. Build up a string containing generated IDs for nodes on the following axis, plus attributes they carry.

test-case.name: key-026
test-case.description: Test of 'generate-id()' on namespace nodes Build up a string containing generated IDs for nodes on the namespace axes of self and all lower elements. Since call-template doesn't change context, iterate by position number.

test-case.name: key-027
test-case.description: Use key() for sorting with apply-templates.

test-case.name: key-028
test-case.description: Use key() for sorting in for-each.

test-case.name: key-029
test-case.description: Test descendants of node-set from key().

result.assert-xml: <out>Intro Section. Body of Intro. Intro to SS subsection. Body of SS Intro. Intro to Appendix. Body of App1. Body of App2. Body of App3sub. </out>

test-case.name: key-030
test-case.description: Test descendants of node-set from key() in a match pattern.

test-case.name: key-031
test-case.description: Test simple key()// filtered by a predicate, in a match pattern.

test-case.name: key-032
test-case.description: test key() in a template match pattern, with a variable reference, not the last step in the pattern

test-case.name: key-033
test-case.description: test key() in an xsl:key, with a variable reference, not the last step in the pattern

test-case.name: key-034
test-case.description: test key() in an xsl:number pattern, with a variable reference, involves atomization, also part of a union pattern

test-case.name: key-035
test-case.description: test key() in an xsl:number pattern, with a variable reference, involves atomization, not the last step in the pattern

test-case.name: key-036
test-case.description: test key() in an xsl:for-each-group pattern, with a variable reference, involves atomization, last step in the pattern

result.assert-xml:
Lee Amby Jules

Daniel Ted Joshua Lauren Pedro

Nate Sam Pablo Ben Lucy Jake Jeff

Christopher Jabriella

test-case.name: key-037
test-case.description: test key() in an xsl:for-each-group pattern, with a variable reference in the key() call, and another in the use expression, involves atomization, last step in the pattern

result.assert-xml:
Lee Amby Jules Daniel Ted Joshua Lauren Pedro Nate Sam Pablo Ben Lucy Jake Jeff

Christopher Jabriella

test-case.name: key-038
test-case.description: Test complex key()// filtered by a predicate in predicate, in a match pattern.

test-case.name: key-039
test-case.description: Test complex key()//x in match pattern.

test-case.name: key-040
test-case.description: Test complex key()//x/x in match pattern.

test-case.name: key-041
test-case.description: Section: 5.2 Test complex key()//x/x, with complex predicate in match pattern.

test-case.name: key-042
test-case.description: Test generate-id() when nodes are coming from different documents. All IDs should be distinct.

test-case.name: key-043
test-case.description: Test combination of key() and document() reading from stylesheet. Elaboration: "Look-up table 1.6 is worth a close look because it uses an advanced XSLT technique. It builds up the lookup-table right in the stylesheet, using a distinct namespace. You can see the x:ns-to-binding elements right below the key. If you are familiar with keys, you are aware that they define indices that will be built on the nodes in the original source document that match the pattern in the match attribute. What is not as well known is that every time an additional source document is loaded with the XSLT document() function, all keys are applied to it as well. The xsl:variable...uses a special form of document() call to load the stylesheet itself as an additional source document. Thus the nodes in the stylesheet that match the ns-to-binding are indexed. This is a very useful technique for setting up a look-up table without having to hack at the source document or depend on an additional file." Lookup table 1.6: WSDL binding types.

test-case.name: key-044
test-case.description: Test two calls to generate-id() on the same file. All IDs should be the same. If both filenames were given literally, the spec says that IDs must match. Retrieving the name from the principal XML document should still clearly mean the same file. Putting nodes in a variable is more of a gray area.

test-case.name: key-045
test-case.description: Test combination of key() and document() on multiple files.

test-case.name: key-046
test-case.description: Test xsl:key with union in "use" attribute. Changed to supply the key values as strings rather than as numbers

test-case.name: key-047
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key, and key() used to create hyperlinks

test-case.name: key-049
test-case.description: Test for xsl:key pattern matching.

test-case.name: key-050
test-case.description: test a key whose value is a node-set, including duplicates

test-case.name: key-051
test-case.description: test a key with a numeric predicate in the match pattern

test-case.name: key-052
test-case.description: test a key with a numeric predicate in the match pattern

test-case.name: key-053
test-case.description: test a key with a boolean predicate in the match pattern

test-case.name: key-054
test-case.description: test key() function with a node-set argument

test-case.name: key-055
test-case.description: A classic 2-level Muenchian Grouping example for each distinct domain

test-case.name: key-056
test-case.description: Select every primary keyword only once despite duplicate key definition

test-case.name: key-058
test-case.description: tests the use of current() within xsl:key. See Saxon bug 520552.

result.assert-xml: <out>Namespace "http://aURI/" used in 1, 4 Namespace "http://bURI/" used in 2 Namespace "" used in 3 </out>

test-case.name: key-059
test-case.description: tests the use of variables within xsl:key match pattern.

test-case.name: key-060
test-case.description: tests the use of variables declared within xsl:key match pattern.

test-case.name: key-061
test-case.description: Test use of variables in a key match pattern (XSLT 2.0)

source.content: <t04> <a id="a" code="1" value="10"/> <a id="b" code="2" value="20"/> <a id="c" code="2" value="30"/> <a id="d" code="1" value="40"/> </t04>

test-case.description: Test use of variables in a key use expression (XSLT 2.0)

test-case.description: Test use of key() in a key use expression (XSLT 2.0)

test-case.description: Test use of key() in a key match expression (XSLT 2.0)

test-case.description: test use of key() in pattern with a variable (XSLT 2.0 feature)

test-case.description: test case for a bug found in Saxon 6.5.2

test-case.name: key-067
test-case.description: test xsl:key with decimal keys

test-case.name: key-068
test-case.description: test xsl:key with type=xs:double

test-case.description: test xsl:key with type=xs:dateTime test key matching on dateTime values Should select a, c, d

test-case.description: test xsl:key with type=xs:double using NaN as a key value

test-case.description: test xsl:key with a multi-valued variable in a key() pattern

test-case.description: Saxon 7.4 bug

test-case.description: test xsl:key containing variables in the use expression

test-case.description: test key() function with three arguments

test-case.description: test xsl:key with two definitions of the same key

test-case.description: Test that xml:id is recognized as an ID attribute

test-case.description: Test that xml:id is recognized in a temporary tree

test-case.description: Two xsl:key definitions with the same name matching overlapping node sets

test-case.description: Error: unknown key name as string literal

test-case.description: Error: unknown key name as run-time expression

test-case.description: test a key with a numeric type

test-case.description: test a key with a numeric type in a template match pattern

test-case.description: test a key whose match pattern declares local range variables

test-case.name: key-085a
test-case.description: Test a key whose match pattern depends on a parameter. See Saxon bug https://saxonica.plan.io/issues/1968 This test and key-085b both work when run individually, but in Saxon 9.5 the second test fails because the index is built based on the original value of the parameter, and is then re-used in the second test.

test-case.name: key-085b
test-case.description: Test a key whose match pattern depends on a parameter. See Saxon bug https://saxonica.plan.io/issues/1968

result.assert: /out = "Amherst Auburn Cambridge Grafton Hudson Lincoln Manchester Pittsfield Rochester Salem Springfield"

test-case.name: key-086
test-case.description: test for xsl:key, with composite="yes".
